wikipedia_page.main: Kathleen Mary Tillotson CBE (3 April 1906 – 3 June 2001) was a British academic and literary critic, professor of English and distinguished Victorian scholar. Her various works on Elizabethan literature have accumulated significance in the literary sphere, conducting important research and producing publications that feature her editorship. Her work has encouraged many to become involved with literary research.

response: *Professor Kathleen Mary Tillotson. For services to English Literature.

response: *Kathleen Mary Tillotson (1906–2001), academic and literary critic, professor of English and distinguished Victorian scholar

Madeline Edith Church was born in Colombo, Sri Lanka in 1903. She attended the Royal Holloway College, London. In 1933, she married Humphry House, a literary critic, with whom she began a new edition of the letters of Charles Dickens in 1949. Following his death, she took on the editorship, and worked with Kathleen Mary Tillotson on the project. Twelve volumes were planned.
